summary: The Palliative Care and Hospice Education and Training Act aims to improve palliative care and hospice services. It amends the Public Health Service Act to increase the number of faculty and training programs in these fields within medical and nursing schools, and other allied health disciplines. The bill authorizes funding for grants and contracts to support academic career development, workforce development fellowships, and create career incentive awards. It also mandates dissemination of palliative care information and enhances palliative care research within the NIH.
